bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Mary Ann and Adaline O'Neill. Sheriff's Answer
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Walla Walla County Government; Clerk, Territorial Court Civil/Criminal Case Files, 1860-1889

div1.p: The George F. Thomas Sheriff of Walla Walla County, Washington Territory to the writ of Habeas Corpus hereto answered

In obedience to the writ of Habeas Corpus hereto command & do hereby certify and whereto the Hon S.G. Winegard Judge of the First Judicial District Washington Territory that before the coming of said writ to me on the 29th day of March 1876 at Walla Walla Washington Territory the said Mary A O'Neil mentioned in said writ was placed in my custody by virtue of a Commitment of said Judicial Court by O. P. Lacy one of the Justice of the Peace in and for Walla Walla County this under my Sentence of said Court for being a Habitual drunkard and disorderly person and ordered to the Committeed to the County Jail of Walla Walla County for the period of one month until she should give bond in the sum of one hundred dollars for her good wherein and that the said Mary A. O'Neil is now in my custody by under of said Commitment a
copy of which is hereto annexed and which I certify and I have here her body before the said Hon S.G. Wingard 'Judge' as by the said writ I have Commanded
